post.body: Hello ZeroMe!
Looking good, let's publish it!
Just pushed some stability fixes for ZeroMe. If the buttons stops working for you please report javascript console for errors (F12) here!

New features to ZeroMe: 
- You can list posts from all users from seeded hubs.
- Changed default post list limit to 10 and "Show more" to button
- Added domain (me.zeronetwork.bit)

Changes in ZeroMe:
- Fixed comment editing + deleting problems
- Filter added for posts from future (users with bad computer time)
- Added counter to users page: We just passed 150 users, wohoo!

Latest ZeroMe changes:
- Comment reply button
- A little explanation on hubs on profile creation page (With this you choose where is your profile stored. There is no difference on content and you will able to reach all users from any hub)
- Clickable links in comments
- Some optimization on database requests (If you run into any problems please report)
- Better formatting `inserted codes`
- Activity feed entries limited to 2 lines
- Cut long usernames/post lines

Latest changes in ZeroMe:
- Fix user's hub detection
- Make usernames bold in comments
- Show activity feed in user profile page, so it allows you see user's latest comments or where did you commented lately
- Allow markdown in profile introduction

ZeroMe improvements:
 - [Post linking](?Post/1RedkCkVaXuVXrqCMpoXQS29bwaqsuFdL/1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj/9)
 - Massive post listing database query speed improvement (10-100x)
 - Activity feed paging

Today's ZeroMe changes:
 - Everyone feed listing activity list also displays comments, likes and follows from every user
 - Activites from last 10 minutes marked with deeper color
 - Experimental scroll fixing: When you reading older posts and a new content arrives it does not affects the scrolling position.
 - New hub for new users: Green hub
 - Color not seeded user's follow button differently
 - Animation optimizations
 - Fix undetectable text fields (eg. introduction text)
 - Fix liked posts display

New things on ZeroMe:
 - Follow your username mentions and comments on your posts in ZeroHello newsfeed
 - Various fixes in stability (also recommended to update ZeroNet client to Rev1422)

ZeroMe update:
 - Search in ZeroMe posts and comments using ZeroHello
 - Changed the like button to image based to make it more compatible 
 - Animation speed improvements
 - Break long introduction lines
 - You can follow new profile followers in the newsfeed

Latest updates:
 - Suggested users based on your followed users followings
 - Don't display new followings in all user's activity feed
 - Merge multiple like/follow into one activity feed item
 - Style quotes
 - Don't scrollfix if mouse is over the right column
 - Fix back button support when clicked post from newsfeed

New features:
 - Follow new comments on posts where you have been commented on/liked. (Starting from now)
 - Add timestamp to post ids to avoid collision

Changes in ZeroMe:
 - Now you can use markdown in comments
 - Highlight usernames in posts
 - Ignore comments/users/activities registered in the future
 - Unfollow post on delete
 - Long posts/comments will be limited by "Read more" button
 - Avoid publish failed errors when using third-party id provider

Interview @ International Business Times:
http://www.ibtimes.co.uk/zeronet-revolutionary-new-decentralised-p2p-internet-post-edward-snowden-world-1580897

> https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/gotenna/gotenna-mesh-off-grid-people-powered-connectivity
> Communicate without cell, wifi & satellites using your existing smartphone. Relay messages through other users to extend range! 

Sound interesting for us, is there any open (and cheaper) alternative to this?

New version 0.5.0:
 - Many optional file enhancements and new API commands
 - Manage optional files and limit optional file HDD usage using ZeroHello
 - Image uploading to ZeroMe
 - Save peers to database to keep them between restarts

Full changelog on [ZeroBlog](http://127.0.0.1:43110/Blog.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post:96:Changelog,+November+8,+2016)

To upload an image it's recommended to have opened port or tor connection and you have to keep your computer running for a while after the upload. (you can see the peer number and the number of uploads for your files of ZeroHello)

You can help distributing other user's optional files by checking "Help distribute this user's images" on user's profile page or you can distribute everyone's new file on the hub by checking "Help distribute all new files" on ZeroHello.

New version 0.5.1: 
 - Multi-language support
 - Favicon for sites
 - Added Hungarian translation for Core, Sidebar, ZeroHello, ZeroTalk, ZeroMe as example, please help translate to other languages! :)

Added multi language support to https://zeronet.io/
Please submit your translation here:
https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/zeronet.io/tree/master/languages

Internet freedom around the world declined in 2016 for the sixth consecutive year.
https://freedomhouse.org/report/freedom-net/freedom-net-2016

Two-thirds of all internet users – 67 percent – live in countries where criticism of the government, military, or ruling family are subject to censorship.

Coffeescript-less and simplified rework of the ZeroChat tutorial:
http://127.0.0.1:43110/Blog.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post:99:ZeroChat+tutorial+(new)
Plus now you can create new site using ZeroHello, so you need no to open command line for the tutorial!
(If you going to do it, please update to Rev1785)

Easy post formatting added to ZeroBlog. Next: Image uploading.
http://127.0.0.1:43110/Blog.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post:100:Easy+post+formatting

Happy New Year! Image uploading added to ZeroBlog! :)
http://127.0.0.1:43110/Blog.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post:101:Image+uploading+and+zooming

I want to add standard .exe/.app/.msi/.dmg installation method for ZeroNet.
Please help if you have any suggestions: [Win](https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/issues/733), [Mac](https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/issues/734)

Richard Stallman reached me if I want to change the licence from GPLv2 to GPLv3. I started researching about the differences, but its  not that easy for me to figurative out how would it affect the real-life use cases.
Any advice?

ZeroNet turned 2 years old today: http://127.0.0.1:43110/Blog.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post:102

Thanks for the year-long support and stay tuned! :)

As requested by lots of users: just added "Hide Hello ZeroMe messages" option to 3dot menu. Enjoy! :)
Also started working on [user mute feature](https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/issues/388#issuecomment-276388811)

Does non-global, only one site muting desirable?

New version: 0.5.2 with user muting:
[More info and changes on ZeroBlog](http://127.0.0.1:43110/Blog.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post:104)

New proxy features in Rev1892:
 - Users from `data/users.json` working as unrestricted admin users, so they can Delete sites/Update version/etc.
 - By using `--multiuser_no_new_sites` normal users will not able to add new sites. (admin users still can)
 - Other security fixes
Time-travel added to ZeroHello: Previous entries will be automatically loaded if you scroll near the bottom of your news feed.

New version 0.5.3 with **zipped content support**, faster connecting and publishing:
[More info and changed on ZeroBlog](http://127.0.0.1:43110/Blog.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post:105:New+version+0.5.3)

New things:
- "Liked" listing option for ZeroMe posts
- Faster post listing
- Activity list display full post in tooltip
- Rev1995: Loading images and optional files should be much faster now.
Some nice thing happening: [The future of us](http://127.0.0.1:43110/Blog.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post:107:The+Future+of+Us)

Just arrived back from my TED rehearsal, New York. (It was a nice experience, but I think I could not live there)
Everything went well, but they want me to include more real life examples, where ZeroNet could have helped avoid censorship or any other way. I have some, but maybe you know a better one, so please let me know if you have some tips! Thanks! :)
Just had a video call with TED organizers and unfortunately they cancelled my talk, because they think it's not the right time for it yet. :(

Just arrived back from Vancouver. Really loved the vivid vegetation of the city and I have experienced many inspiring TED talks.
Have I missed out anything in the past 2 weeks? :)

Richard in latest episode of Silicon Valley (S04E03) is developing a P2P, Fully decentralized internet.
Sounds like a great idea! :)
(Thanks oscarpaca for the tip)

comment.body: If you followed someone from other hub, then it's got added to your client.
Newuser123: What Browser/OS are you using? (I forgot to check Firefox/Safari, doing it now)
Currently only publishing to one hub, but it could be possible to add option to choose which one you want to publish to.
Lets test it. Edit: Test
Looks like works here

no official way, but you can: open javascript console (F12), choose inner-frame from dropdown, enter: Page.cmd("dbQuery", "SELECT json.user_name FROM follow LEFT JOIN json USING (json_id) WHERE follow.user_name = 'GomZik'")
fixed!
You can try check javascript console (F12) maybe there is an error there.
Double hubbing is not tested yet, but I will check it later.
Test 123
Security test: <script>alert('test')</script> http://any.com/other?bla=ja&ha=bla'" & &ja
@ZAlex: Thanks, done!

@Nofish: Reply test
@Teszt: Reply2 test
@P2pwave: You dont have to update your ZeroNet client, just press F5 on the browser, then if you put your mouse cursor over any comment you will see a reply link (like in ZeroTalk)
@Cyborg Warrior: All you need is javascript + html + css. There is a tutorial on ZeroBlog, if you are interested you should start with that.
@Scrub: Enabled markdown on profile introduction text
@Bot: Thx, fixed
Live source reloading only works on plugins, but it needs pyfilesystem installed and its only supports windows

I think they removed the unauthenticated api. It would be good idea to create a bot that posts on ZeroMe if someone mentions it's name on twitter. Eg.: "This is great! @ZeroMeBot" and the bot would post it to it's ZeroMe profile.
And probably also the inverse of it: If someone mentions @ZeroMeBot on ZeroMe, then it would post on Twitter.
It's also easy to fake hashes, so I don't think is possible to solve this problem.
You can also use --ui_restrict yourcomputerip or enable UiPassword plugin then start it --ui_password mysecretpassword
@Empirezero: Thanks, fixed!
@ZAlex: Yeah, its planned
ok, whats the bug?

you will see a download button on the user's profile that you are not seeding currently

+ simply visiting the hub (127.0.0.1:43110/anyhub) will also add it to zerome
@GomZik: Only the merger site need permission to access the hubs. From that point it will access all ZeroMe typed sites. (merger type is defined in content.json)
It happens when you reset your profile or register on an another hub without keeping your next_post_id
@Musickiller: Then no idea: I have checked the data files, they all commented on your 26. post, so everything looks fine from technical perspective.
Running merger site on a hub is not recommended and against the basic idea of merger sites (separate site and display logic).
@GomZik: It's defines your site's type, if you enter ZeroMe there, than all ZeroMe merger site will able to access it. If you planning to create non zerome compatible hubs, then use different type.
This does not fixes all the problems and leads other errors. From the next version the merger permission will be automatically revoked from merged sites.
use zerobundle package (https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet#how-to-join) or python -m pip install gevent
Please update to latest version and try with --connected_limit 5
Only one level of merging supported and i dont see any usecase that requires anymore than that
Please use https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroMe for feature requests.

Problems: Needs much more user to make it any useful, you only able to search in content you already seeding, so ZeroNet's P2P/distributed structure not really suitable for this. Maybe there could be centralized bots that constantly scanning many hubs for new content and aggregate the most popular ones into one site.
@Tkarita: Sure,but it's only search in hubs that you serving.
@Sirenyc: You should check the console for error messages if the semi-auto-update is not working for you
@Dios: If you don't own the user's private key then it's not possible to delete/modify hid/her comments.
@ZAlex: More detailed list of changes: https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroMe/commits/master
@Wakelain: Currently it's saved in browser's local storage, so eg. if you use tor browser it will purged every time you close it.
@Quadrangle: If someone starts following you you will be notified in the newsfeed

@Musickiller: Tab + Enter just works fine. I don't really like ctrl+enter or shift+enter, because in some applications it means "send message" in other applications it means "don't send message, but break the line", but tab+enter is pretty predicatable

If you edit your profile it sends to 2 sites: To your hub and the userdb site. So probably for some reasons the userdb site was failed to update. I have changed the limit there to 2kb, maybe that was the problem.
Then please check the debug.log maybe there is some error
@Shellbound: Well the closest link is the submit button. (except when commenting where you send it with simple enter)
@Musickiller: It's not related, you can try to delete the userdb site and re-add it (1UDbADib99KE9d3qZ87NqJF2QLTHmMkoV)
Sorry, no idea, you can try to re-install zeronet to see if its helps or check the logs and js console for any error
If someone sends me the last ~1000 lines of debug.log and the javascript console content to hello@zeronet.io then i can look at it

```
code
```
should work
if you send me your debug.log and js console (F12) content, i will look at it: hello@zeronet.io
If you delete it, then it's gone. Automatic deletion is planned to be added later. I have just raised your limit.
@Musickiller: Comments are stored in user's file and you can only delete your own ones.
@Userzero: Probably that site is not ready for cloning
@Userzero: Just installed Tor browser and works here (currently sending this using it), so try reinstall it/remove all extensions/restart computer/etc.

@Talnicrom: I don't think if hashtags could be any useful with small amount of users. + The older (eg. 1 week old) posts will be constantly purged, so it's also a limitation on usability of that feature.

@Userzero: Sorry, can't help, I only own privatekey for *.zeronetwork.bit sites
@Wakelain: It's based on what your followed users following
@Talnicrom: If you check/uncheck the follow option, then it should re-add it to your users.json
@Talnicrom: No, the "Follow username mentions" under the 3dot menu

@Wakelain: It's possible to create a non-javascript client (eg. in c++), but then you have to run the binary, which is much bigger security risk, than running javascript in browser sandboxing. So not really.
it's not hardcoded you can change using --fileserver_port. you can find other options via zeronet.py --help

@Talnicrom: You can already do it with zerome: simply clone/pause the site, then the javascript code will remain the same, but you will still receive the profile updates, since they are on a different site
@Talnicrom: Easiest way: curl http://127.0.0.1:43110/anysite, then it will download the site to the data dir
@Musickiller: Sure, but it wont help users who has the same problem
@Bela333: yeah

@Cyborg Warrior: Currently there is no way to add per-site torrent tracker, but there is 8 tracker added in ZeroNet, so it's probably not the problem. Huge sites (1000s of files) can be a problem. Your root content.json should not be larger than 100kb.
@Sirenyc: Currently usually it's only me
Removed the white background on the field.

@Mikhailobv: According to their persentation @ Decentralized Web Summit they not really P2P and needs list of trusted database servers to work.
https://www.reddit.com/r/Bitcoin/comments/4j7wjf/bigchaindb_a_prime_example_of_blockchain_bullshit/
i need the log/debug.log file and the content of javascript console F12, my email hello@zeronet.io
@Musickiller: got it, can you please look at your data\1UDbADib99KE9d3qZ87NqJF2QLTHmMkoV\data\userdb\15NScazvsCHNmiXi6o6nvaMiwjeJYizgZQ\content.json file's site? It should be around 678 bytes
@Musickiller: Can you please send it to me? (+ if you have other file in that directory then that one too)

@Musickiller: looks like the signature in this file is not valid for some reasons. Please try this from command line: `zeronet.py --debug --verbose siteSign 1UDbADib99KE9d3qZ87NqJF2QLTHmMkoV --inner_path data/userdb/15NScazvsCHNmiXi6o6nvaMiwjeJYizgZQ/content.json --publish` (it will ask your zeroid privatekey which is in user.json: auth_privatekey entry at zeroid.bit cert)
@Musickiller: It should work while it's running

@Userzero: You can clone this sites if you want to add new features to them

@Kaffie: When you create a new/modify profile, it tries to save it to the userdb site. From now it will not do that if the cert provider is not supported by that site: https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroMe/commit/5c6734c21b9dfe95e23ba909e08b12f07767a3e3
Yeah, thanks for reporting, fixed!
Because of the sandboxed iframe enviroment target="_blank" is not working for every links (eg youtube), so target="_top" is recommended for every zeronet links
It could be possible, but webcrypto provides many features: https://github.com/diafygi/webcrypto-examples
No cross-site linking allowed (it would allow the poster to silently force your client to download and seed a new site). Image uploading could be possible by optional files in the future.
@Sirenyc: Spam protection has been added to zeroboard, whats the message you want to submit and the error you got? File validating has been disabled in the latest revision. (Rev1521)
@Sirenyc: Sorry, unable to reproduce, please specify the message you want to submit + check you js console for errors (F12)
@Talnicrom: Probably there is an error happens onclick event, enable "Preverse log" option in the js console and try again
@P2P: Yeah something like that
@Wakelain: It could be possible, but only if you also seeding the user's hub.
the "merged-ZeroMe/ZeroMe.db" should be ignored from content.json, since it generated by the client and this way the db will be corrupt for the users and generate constant cpu/bw usage

@Musickiller7777: I just got my Orange Pi One today (It was only [3.6USD with shipping](http://www.cnx-software.com/2016/09/19/orange-pi-one-development-board-sells-for-3-69-shipped-promo/) some weeks ago), but I unable to find a charger that fits to it's power input and it does not supports usb powering :(

@PaintNinja: There is issues with Chrome and ZeroNet from version 55. The developers accepted the [issue](https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=658530&start=100&num=100) as "blocker", so hopefully they will fix it before it hits the stable channel.
@P2P: Pinned files will not be deleted even if you run out of limit
@Xeers: You can ignore it, it's fake detection. If you don't trust ZeroBundle's python.exe you can download it from https://www.python.org/downloads/ (you need 2.7.x)
@Sirenyc: Only sites with optional files are displayed on that list. We does not store  statistics for normal files, so can't display them.
You can try stop, delete data/content.db, start again

Normally ZeroNet cleans up peers that not returned by tracker or via pex in the last 1-4 hour (depends on how many peers on the site)
Pinging every peer would be slow (we using tcp only) and measuring the recent contribution is also hard in trust-less p2p way
The peer number is only one factor on [cleanup algorithm](https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/blob/master/plugins/OptionalManager/ContentDbPlugin.py#L276-L330), to avoid re-downloading often accessed resources the client's last access time (via the web interface) is more important factor.

@ZAlex: Images resized automatically to max. 900x700px displayed as max 530x600px on listing.
Not sure yet, need pull request @ github
@P2P: No plans yet

@P2P: animated gifs are huge (1MB-30MB) so it's not realy good for p2p storage/distirbution. mp4 is much smaller (used on giftime) could be possible, but then everyone has to convert it for him/herself
@P2P: Maybe it's possible with javascript, but the library is huge (30MB) and very slow (takes minutes to convert some second gif)

@P2P: Opened an issue for it: https://discuss.gogs.io/t/mirror-function-stopped-working-on-try-gogs-io/779/1 
Bitbucket does not support live git sync as far as i know.
@Greatsick: you need to make copy of src/Translate/languages/hu.json file to add them.
other sites later...
@Firebox: It was incompatible with firefox, fixed!

@P2P: Currently the translation is partial, I will add it to ZeroHello if the other files will be translated as well (at least Sidebar and ZeroHello)
To test it you can add language = zh to zeronet.conf

Chinese translation is complete and live! ( thanks to @lmath)
@Balancer73, @Mkg20001: Added translations instructions [to ZeroBlog](http://127.0.0.1:43110/blog.zeronetwork.bit/?Post:97:New+version:+0.5.1#Comments)
@Lmath: I can't reproduce the error in FF or Chrome, but I see no side effect, so added to css

@Lmath: It's brokes the "this is my site changer", so other workaround is needed. (I can't reproduce, so cant fix)

Update: can you please check if "clear: both;" to .settings-owner fixes the problem?
@P2P: ZeroBundle downloads ZeroNet, so its translated
Yes, only a-zA-Z0-9_@=\.\+-/ allowed
I have just tried and zipfile fails to open any broken file

@P2P: https://gist.github.com/HelloZeroNet/b03479e404836728faa8f1acc4ccf781
So basically I tried open the zip file after every 1024 bytes and every attempt failed except the last one.
@P2P: The startup error message could help. (or if there is log/error.log)

@P2P: That affected rev1700 and [fixed](https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/commit/57df94afee269a782ce0944c6b07c445bcbc9efb) in rev1702, but its only broke the restart mechanism, so if you restarted it manually, then it should have worked. 
You said "installation of ZeroNet is completely broken", if you sure about that, then this error is not relevant to that.
@Mkg20001: Thanks, added: https://zeronet.io/de
Thanks! Added: https://zeronet.io/it

@P2P: 2.7.2 is very old (5years+) and not supported. I think https://kivy.org is the best way to add python applications to android/ios, but I have not experience with mobile development, so not sure if its suitable.
@P2P: According to https://github.com/kivy/kivy/wiki/Batch-installer-for-windows%28KivyInstaller%29 Defaults: Python versions 2.7.11, 3.4.4
@P2P: Also here is a PR for Python 2.7.11 support: https://github.com/kivy/python-for-android/pull/775 and an another repo for 2.7.12: https://github.com/opacam/python-for-android/tree/python-2.7.12
Thanks! Fixed!
On chrome: F12, F1, uncheck: Enable js source maps

They fixed my bugreport quickly: https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=658530&start=100&num=100
(zeronet stopped working in chrome 55)

@说鸡不说巴: There is trackers on Tor network, so it should not be a problem. And since 0.5.0 the peers are saved between restarts, so your ZeroNet client will still work even if you can't reach any tracker.
The network distribute the user's json files. The .db downloaded from other users, but automatically generated from the json files (so its just a cache for faster and easier data access)
I'm planning to do a level2 version of the chat tutorial with Merger sites feature (channels), Newsfeed, and maybe image uploading
Thanks for reporting, fixed in Rev1786

Modifying the json file would require re-sign every site, so it's not really an option.  instead somehow we have to modify the verification process to round it down to 6 digits.
First you have to find out if the problem is happens when you dumps or loads the json file. On win with 32bit python:
```
>>> json.loads("1481887697.3245959832")
1481887697.324596
>>> json.dumps(1481887697.3245959832)
'1481887697.324596'
```
@ulrichard: Before the everything packed-in zerobundle linux release there was lots of problems with outdated packages, so I would prefer something like http://snapcraft.io/
@公共: By default the sites limited to 10MB, probably you try to add more content than that. You can see the error message in log/debug.log
@公共: You need to add "optional": "data/optional/.*", to content.json, so the files in the data/optional directory will be excluded from site limit

It's very tricky problem, were you able to compile newer version of python for android or it's official, old one?
Is there any android emulator where it's possible to try and debug it?

@P2P: I downloaded and installed RemixOS Player and unfortunetly in qpython console it looks ok: 
```
>> json.loads("1481887697.3245959832")
1481887697.324596
```
@P2P: Nice! It got the error, so I can debug it :)

Thanks for the suggestion, I implemented a simpler fix: https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/commit/3afca90c0e02e0ef1165add321e1edf0c5b5080d (I was unable to test it, so please add feedback if its working correctly)
@P2P: I just checked and it does not affects my chip computer (32bit arm)

@P2P: For some reasons it's no longer boots up for me (and it was unreliable anyway), so have not tried.
I think the 565 check should works on every platform that affected by this bug. (but if not then we can adjust it later)
@12hlearn: I think it's not parsed by markdown, but a simple utf8 insert: 😄 So only need to find a similar looking, light and vanilla-js emoji picker.

@P2P: Maybe only the cert generation broken, so you can try to copy data/*.pem files from your local client then start it with `--keep_ssl_cert`
I would start ZeroNet to [separate process](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/1196074/how-to-start-a-background-process-in-python), so it will not hurt eachother.

@P2P: It's just for testing maybe there is a python-only cert generation as workaround. Pem files are not really sensitive data, because it's dropped and re-generated after every startup. Python can't do 2 thing at the same time (called GIT), so creating a new process is the only way to make run acceptable.
eg.: would it prevent people to run proxies that allows access only some, white-listed sites?
Other question: Since it contains code from other contributors can I change the license of the project at all?
@Martinv: Did, but got an out-of-office autoreply
@P2P: I will try to find a way to reproduce it, but I have no experience in mobile development and has no smartphone at all, so it would be nice if someone take care about the mobile deployment.
@P2P: We can request for example facebook/twitter profile verification

@ks: Indeed it is, but I don't think PoW is suitable to solve this problem in long-term. Eg. my cpu can solve a PoW task in 1 day and spammer's GPU can do the same easily in 10 minute. 
So in result he will be able to create a new account every 10 minute and at the same time we require "Open ZeroNet client, leave your computer open for 1 day on 100% cpu usage" for every new users.

@ks: I think require POW on posting is even worse: I don't think if anyone would use the network if he/she require to wait 1 minute (or even more if we thing about mobiles) with 100% CPU usage after try to submit a comment and at the same time the spammer with a better CPU/GPU could post 100s of new comment at the same time.
@ks: I don't think anyone targeting ZeroID with automated account creation, so captcha is not a solution here.
@ks: It also would be horrible user experience

@ks: I see spam is going to be a problem at a point, that's why I think facebook/twitter profile verification should be required or as alternative there could be cryptocurrency proof-of-burn (or donate) solution.
@P2P: 4 new account created in the past 1 hour. I think IP based banning is not really effective, since anyone can request a new one using Tor.

@P2P: It's not unusual and I don't think we can do anything about it.

@12hlearn: Yeah it's planned
@P2P: It would be hard to add, since zeronet is file-based, and one file update can contain multiple new additions/deletions/etc.
@P2P: There is already limitation on that: Publish delayed... message if you try to add updates too often.

The only way is modify a site's content is using the fileWrite command. If your site is running in "This is my site", then you can write any file using this method. (even index.html) 
Without this mode enabled you can only modify your user's files in the data/users directory.
On the proxies setting this mode on by using the sidebar is disabled.

@P2P: sha512 slower on 32bit machines, but faster on 64 bit ones. (thats why ZeroNet using sha512 vs sha256) The "openssl verify" speed is more important factor in general.
I'm not sure why is it so much slower on android, maybe you can try newer python version. Other than that I think we can't do anything.
@Nekocross: To maximize compatibility the windows ZeroBundle is currently 32bit. It could be possible to add 20-30% speed boost by moving to 64bit. (macOS and Linux versions are 64bit ones)
You don't have to worry about os.random speed, and the 13MB/sec sha512 verification speed is also OK.
@Nekocross: Yes, 100 000 random number in 9.042s means it takes 0.09ms to generate one, so it's negligible. (we need to generate one per page request for nonce)

I have just did some benchmarks on 32bit vs 64bit on Windows and the speedup is more than it tought:
sign x 10: 0.095s vs 0.040s
openssl verify x 100: 0.120s vs 0.057s
sha512 5M x 10: 0.208s vs 0.123s
so probably it would be nice to have a 64bit binary for win.

Fixed in the last version: It will not delete anything if it fails to get the free space and the limit is defined in percent.
I recommend to add `optional_limit = 1` to the config file of the Android version, so it limit it to fixed 1GB that does not requires to query the free space
@P2P: If the limit specified in percent and getFreeSpace() return -1, then it will skip the deletion, if it's specified in exact GB, then it will delete the files

I ran some more benchmarks on Win10 with interesting results:
```
|                      	| 32bit  	| 64bit  	| WLS 64bit 	|
|----------------------	|--------	|--------	|-----------	|
| sign x 10            	| 0.095s 	| 0.045s 	| 0.040s    	|
| openssl verify x 100 	| 0.120s 	| 0.072s 	| 0.057s    	|
| sha512 5M x 10       	| 0.208s 	| 0.083s 	| 0.123s    	|
```

So for some reason Windows Linux Subsystem significantly faster, than native python .exe.

@P2P: The current mode is synchronous = OFF and journal_mode = MEMORY

I was unable to reproduce data corruption on Win + HDD + Python 2.7.12 + Sqlite 3.8.11
Did some benchmarking with [journal_mode](https://www.sqlite.org/pragma.html#pragma_journal_mode) and [synchronous](https://www.sqlite.org/pragma.html#pragma_synchronous) parameters:

```
synchronous = OFF
Transaction    With (1M)    Without (10k)
DELETE         1.62s        13.56s
WAL            1.90s         0.09s
MEMORY         1.63s         0.36s
TRUNCATE       1.63s         0.93s
PERSIST        1.63s         0.38s
OFF            1.63s         0.31s

synchronous = NORMAL
Transaction    With (1M)    Without (10k)
DELETE         2.50s          690s
WAL            3.29s         1.72s
MEMORY         1.63s          370s
TRUNCATE       2.42s          722s
PERSIST        2.72s          848s
OFF            2.42s          362s
```

Only synchronous mode protect from OS/power failure, but the speed drawback is significant. (2-100 times)

Can you check sqlite version on Android/Kivy? (it's displayed on /Benchmark page if you using the latest rev)

@P2P: Yes, that's what I measured with transaction. (left column groupped, right column one-by-one)
Everything is grouped what possible, but it's not always and ZeroNet is single threaded, so if we enable synchronous mode, then it will block the whole application while it writing.

@P2P: Well you can check the speed on /Benchmark, for me:
WAL mode:
- Insert x 10 x 1000..........0.741s [x1.35: Fine]
- Buffered insert x 100 x 100..........0.570s [x2.28: Fast]

MEMORY mode:
- Insert x 10 x 1000..........0.361s [x2.77: WOW]
- Buffered insert x 100 x 100..........0.504s [x2.58: WOW]

I got no site lock violation yet, but I will keep running it.
@P2P: Every site you seed has a assigned .onion address. site lock violation happens if someone try to request a file from a site that is not assigned to that .onion address.
Thanks, fixed! I switched to Tor always mode and the release script was not executed correctly. It should work now and I think I also found and fixed the site lock bug.
